channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: A new malware service promises to skip Google's review process and get your malware straight onto the Chrome Store
item.description: The malware spoofs entire websites, while keeping the address bar intact.

item.title: Fin de l’ADSL : l’État peut verser jusqu’à 1 200 € pour financer un raccordement à la fibre
item.description: Le réseau cuivre est en sursis. À l'horizon 2030, il sera remplacé par la fibre sur tout le territoire, mais une échéance va tomber très vite : à compter du 31 janvier, des milliers de foyers et d'entreprises ne pourront plus souscrire à de nouveaux abonnements ADSL. Une aide financière de l'État est disponible sous certaines conditions pour financer des travaux de raccordement chez les usagers concernés....

item.title: Dozens of nudify apps found on Google and Apple’s app stores
item.description: Removing or restricting access to Grok's AI image editor might not be enough to stop the flood of nonconsensual sexualized images being generated by AI. A report from the Tech Transparency Project (TTP) released on Tuesday found dozens of AI "nudify" apps similar to Grok on Google and Apple's platforms, as previously reported by CNBC. […]

item.title: A TikTok US power outage caused a 'cascading systems failure' leading to multiple bugs
item.description: If your TikTok feed has felt a little off lately, it's not just you. TikTok says is still working to fix its service in the US following a power outage at one of its data centers that's caused “multiple bugs” in the app. TikTok users have reported problems logging in and uploading videos, as well as strange behavior from the "for you" algorithm. Creators have also noticed that new uploads are seemingly getting o views or likes and that in-app earnings have disappeared."Since yesterday we’ve been working to restore our services following a power outage at a U.S. data center impacting TikTok and...

item.title: Google Agenda : fini le casse-tête pour organiser des réunions, cette nouveauté de Gemini va vous sauver
item.description: L'IA Gemini de Google se dote d'une fonctionnalité bien pratique dans l'application Agenda. Elle permet d'organiser des rendez-vous à plusieurs très facilement.

item.title: Amazon is closing its physical Amazon Go and Amazon Fresh stores
item.description: These retail closures will not impact customers who use Amazon for grocery delivery.

item.title: Turntable legend Pro-Ject has a weird but wonderful new hi-fi box – it's a phono stage, streaming hub, DAC, TV HDMI connector, and headphone amp all in one
item.description: The Pro-Ject Pre Box S3 brings all your audio sources together

item.title: Grosse puissance et autonomie : le pionnier de la moto électrique lance son tout premier scooter électrique à un prix attractif
item.description: Zero Motorcycles, le pionnier californien de la moto électrique, franchit une étape symbolique pour son vingtième anniversaire. La marque s'attaque pour la première fois au marché du scooter urbain avec le LS1, un modèle équivalent 125 cm³ qui mise sur une autonomie record et une technologie héritée de ses modèles hautes performances.

item.title: Fnac et Darty dévoilent leurs meilleures offres juste avant la fin des soldes : voici les 20 deals à saisir
item.description: Dès demain, la dernière démarque des soldes d’hiver débute chez Fnac et Darty. C’est votre ultime chance de profiter de réductions exceptionnelles sur une large sélection Tech — smartphones, tablettes, ordinateurs et bien plus encore — avant la fin de l’évènement !

item.title: Pornhub Will Block New UK Users Starting Next Week to Protest ‘Flawed’ ID Law
item.description: Only users who have already registered and completed age verification will be able to access the world's largest porn site.

item.title: Liquid Web vs InMotion Hosting: VPS hosting compared
item.description: Liquid Web vs InMotion Hosting: VPS hosting compared

item.title: Lego’s Newest ‘Star Wars’ Smart Play Sets Are Cheaper, With a Huge Catch
item.description: Lego's push for smart bricks in the galaxy far, far away is continuing, and things are only getting weirder.

item.title: The Return of Nintendo’s Worst-Selling Console Could Be More Glorious Than We Thought
item.description: Get ready to return to the neck-straining magic of red and black gaming with several never-released games for the Virtual Boy.

item.title: I've had this compact B&O speaker for 4 months now – here are 3 reasons it's better than the JBL Charge 6
item.description: The last few months with B&O’s audiophile-friendly Bluetooth speaker have been so amazing, I’d pick it over JBL’s Bluetooth speakers – for these 3 reasons.

item.title: Pourquoi la France ne va pas vraiment pouvoir interdire les réseaux sociaux aux ados
item.description: Malgré une première adoption de la loi sur l’interdiction des réseaux sociaux aux moins de 15 ans en France, l'État ne pourra jamais vraiment la faire appliquer. Ce n'est pas son rôle.

item.title: Le prix de l’aspirateur balai Dyson V12 Origin est en chute libre pendant les soldes d’hiver
item.description: Dyson est devenu, avec le temps, la référence des aspirateurs-balais haut de gamme. En témoigne le modèle V12 Origin que Cdiscount rend bien plus abordable avec cette réduction de près de 200 euros pour les soldes d'hiver.

item.title: Snowmageddon Continues: Another Major Storm Could Slam the East Coast This Weekend
item.description: It’s looking increasingly likely that a coastal storm could bring more snow to the East Coast this weekend—and potentially strengthen into a bomb cyclone.

item.title: How Moonshot's Kimi K2.5 helps AI builders spin up agent swarms easier than ever
item.description: Chinese company Moonshot AI upgraded its open-sourced Kimi K2 model, transforming it into a coding and vision model with an architecture that supports an agent swarm orchestration. The new model, Moonshot Kimi K2.5, could offer a compelling orchestration option for enterprises that, instead of building an overarching framework that decides when agents complete a task, want agents to pass off actions to the next agent automatically. The company characterized Kimi K2.5 as an “all-in-one model” that supports both visual and text inputs, allowing users to leverage the model for more “visual” codin...

item.title: Votre opérateur sait où vous êtes : Apple met fin à ce pistage (mais pas pour tous)
item.description: Votre opérateur mobile sait exactement où vous êtes, à la seconde près, grâce aux antennes relais. C'est un fait établi depuis des années, mais Apple a décidé de siffler la fin de la récréation avec iOS 26.3. Une nouvelle option de confidentialité va brouiller les pistes, mais attention : il faudra montrer patte blanche pour en profiter.

item.title: 'I think, ultimately, we could have made a different trailer' — Wildlight Entertainment CEO wishes 'Highguard had been received better' amidst the game's negative review score on Steam
item.description: Wildlight Entertainment's CEO has admitted the studio could have marketed Highguard better following radio silence leading up to its launch.

item.title: France just approved a social media ban for kids under 15
item.description: Legislators approved the bill, which also bans the use of mobile phones in high schools. French lawmakers approved a bill banning social media for children under 15, paving the way for the measure to enter into force at the start of the next school year in September, as the idea of setting a minimum age for use of the platforms gains momentum across Europe.The bill, which also bans the use of mobile phones in high schools, was adopted by a 130-21 vote late Monday. French President Emmanuel Macron has requested that the legislation be fast-tracked and it will now be discussed by the Senate in t...

item.title: Pinterest layoffs today: 15% of jobs cut as social media giant is latest to cite shift to AI
item.description: The platform’s stock price plummeted by more than 8% after news of the reduction in workforce. Nike isn’t the only household corporate name to announce significant layoffs this week. Just a day after the sporting goods giant announced layoffs, citing a further embrace of automation, social media giant Pinterest has announced it will cut jobs. The driving factor here? Artificial intelligence....

item.title: The EU tells Google to give external AI assistants the same access to Android as Gemini has
item.description: The European Commission has started proceedings to ensure Google complies with the Digital Markets Act (DMA) in certain ways. Specifically, the European Union’s executive arm has told Google to grant third-party AI services the same level of access to Android that Gemini has. "The aim is to ensure that third-party providers have an equal opportunity to innovate and compete in the rapidly evolving AI landscape on smart mobile devices," the Commission said in a statement. The company will also have to hand over "anonymized ranking, query, click and view data held by Google Search" to rival searc...

item.title: This 512GB Samsung P9 microSD Express card is 33 percent off
item.description:
MicroSD Express cards are still a little hard to find, considering they're pretty new and only really started becoming popular last year once the Switch 2 came out. These upgraded versions of microSD cards are the only ones compatible with the Switch 2 for expanding its storage, os if you're already starting to feel the crunch on your console, it's worth picking one up. Samsung's P9 microSD Express card is on sale right now — you can grab the 512GB version of $80, which is 33 percent off and one of the best prices we've seen.
The P9 boasts transfer speeds of up to 800MB/s, making moving game...

item.title: I thought Virtual Boy on Nintendo Switch Online was laughable, but now that we're getting two unreleased games and a color change option I'm happy to be proven wrong
item.description: Nintendo Switch Online's Virtual Boy lineup includes two games no one has ever played before.

item.title: 15 stylish home office payday finds under $50 at IKEA that finally fix clutter
item.description: I went searching IKEA for the cheapest home office gear to keep your workspace organized, and this is what I found.

item.title: AirPods 4 with ANC drop to $119
item.description:
Every time Apple's AirPods 4 with active noise cancelation go on sale I have the same thought: maybe I made a mistake. Don't get me wrong, I love my regular AirPods 4, but the noise canceling aspect makes their sister pair very enticing. Take now, for instance, when the AirPods 4 with ANC are on sale for $119, down from $179. The 34 percent discount brings them to only $4 more than the standard AirPods 4 current sale price and below their usual $129. While we've seen the ANC model as low as $99, the $119 price tag is the best deal we've seen so far this year.
Apple released its fourth-gene...

item.title: How the Minneapolis shooting of Alex Pretti is impacting gun rights politics for Trump
item.description: Prominent Trump supporters have called for a probe into Pretti’s death. Prominent Republicans and gun rights advocates helped elicit a White House turnabout this week after bristling over the administration’s characterization of Alex Pretti, the second person killed this month by a federal officer in Minneapolis, as responsible for his own death because he lawfully possessed a weapon.The death produced no clear shifts in U.S. gun politics or policies, even as President Donald Trump shuffles the lieutenants in charge of his militarized immigration crackdown. But important voices in Trump’s coal...

item.title: Forget Dutton Ranch — Yellowstone fans need to stream this disturbing crime thriller to see one star in a role they’ve ‘never done before’
item.description: Dutton Ranch is my most anticipated TV show of 2026 — but this Yellowstone star’s ‘messy’ and ‘terrifying’ new thriller is more disturbing than the wild west.

item.title: The Daredevil: Born Again season 2 trailer is pure sensory overload — and it confirms when the Marvel TV show will return on Disney+
item.description: Marvel has revealed the official release date and first trailer for Daredevil: Born Again season 2.

item.title: Risotto raises $10M seed to use AI to make ticketing systems easier to use
item.description: Designed to autonomously resolve help desk tickets, Risotto has raised $10 million in seed funding in a round led by Bonfire Ventures.

item.title: You’ll be able to change the color of Virtual Boy games on Nintendo Switch Online
item.description: Following the initial reveal last September, Nintendo has released a new trailer detailing which Virtual Boy games will be available to Switch Online subscribers starting on February 17th alongside revamped headsets, and which titles will launch later this year. The company also revealed some new features for the games, including the option to change the […]...

item.title: Samsung’s TriFold phone will cost $2,899 in the US
item.description: The phone's display unfolds twice to reveal a 10-inch display, which is the largest screen ever on a Galaxy phone.

item.title: eSIM adoption could reach a major milestone in 2026 - but can providers cope with demand, especially in IoT?
item.description: 2026 will see a 30% rise in eSIM devices, but they're for IoT not smartphones, so a whole new model is being rolled out.

item.title: Nintendo va sortir des jeux inédits en 2026 sur la console qui a le plus flop de son histoire
item.description: Non seulement, Nintendo va ressortir son casque de VR Virtual Boy, mais la firme va aussi sortir des jeux inédits, développés dans les années 1990.

item.title: Réseaux sociaux interdits aux moins de 15 ans : la Commission européenne donne son feu vert, mais…
item.description: Oui, la France a le droit d'interdire l'accès aux réseaux sociaux aux moins de 15 ans. Mais seule la Commission européenne aura la compétence pour faire appliquer cette interdiction à Tiktok, Instagram, Snap et les autres grands réseaux sociaux, a rappelé la Commission européenne lors d'un point presse ce mardi 27 janvier, dont voici les points principaux....

item.title: LG's new subscription service could turn the world of expensive OLED TVs on its head — here's what I think as a deals expert
item.description: LG and Raylo have announced a new partnership that enables you to hire a new LG OLED TV, soundbar or gaming monitor for as little as £15 per month, but is this offer really as good as it sounds?

item.title: Independent auditors confirm Surfshark’s VPN infrastructure as secure
item.description: Surfshark has completed a comprehensive independent security audit of its network infrastructure. SecuRing found no critical vulnerabilities, reinforcing the provider's claims of resilience against sophisticated cyberattacks.

item.title: The First ‘Daredevil: Born Again’ Season 2 Trailer Brings Back Jessica Jones
item.description: Welcome back to Hell's Kitchen when 'Daredevil: Born Again' returns to Disney+ in less than two months.

item.title: Tesla’s robotaxis are cheaper than Waymo, but the wait times are longer
item.description: Tesla's robotaxis are not robotaxis in the sense that they're not fully driverless and still feature safety monitors with access to a kill switch in case anything goes wrong. But the automaker is shaking things up with its approach to pricing, according to a new analysis of the nascent market. Obi, an app that aggregates […]

item.title: Yahoo Scout looks like a more web-friendly take on AI search
item.description: Yahoo's big AI play is, in many ways, actually a return to the company's roots. Three decades ago, Yahoo was known as "Jerry's guide to the world wide web," and was designed as a sort of all-encompassing portal to help people find good stuff on an increasingly large, hard-to-parse internet. In the early aughts, the […]

item.title: Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni’s Phia raises $35M to ‘make shopping fun again’
item.description: “We’re on the cusp of a completely new way of shopping,” Gates told TechCrunch.

item.title: Airtable gets into the AI agent game with Superagent
item.description: SuperAgent is Airtable's first standalone product in its 13-year history, and signals both the company's ambitions and the reality of the current AI moment: every serious software player is racing to prove they can deliver on agents.

item.title: NYT Strands hints and answers for Wednesday, January 28 (game #696)
item.description: Looking for NYT Strands answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, including the spangram.

item.title: Quordle hints and answers for Wednesday, January 28 (game #1465)
item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: NYT Connections hints and answers for Wednesday, January 28 (game #962)
item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.title: Yahoo claps back on AI search engines with Yahoo Scout
item.description: The legacy web company still commands staggering internet mindshare as it pivots into the AI age with an AI search engine of its own. Yahoo may not be the most headlined company in tech anymore, but its reach can’t be denied. With nearly 250 million monthly users across the country and 700 million globally, it’s still the second most popular email client in the world, and the third most popular search engine in the U.S. (even though that search engine has technically been powered by either Bing or Google since 2009)....

item.title: This new privacy-focused phone service is designed to keep your phone from getting hacked
item.description: Cape, which offers a range of enhanced privacy and security measures, is now offering service across the United States. A privacy-centric cellphone carrier called Cape is now officially available across the United States, offering a unique set of features to protect users from surveillance and identity theft.

item.title: I’m tired of predictable heist thrillers – but here’s why the trailer for Tuner has restored my faith in the genre
item.description: Leo Woodall stars in this new thriller about a piano tuner turned criminal, and I already think it's a genius concept.

item.title: Un premier test montre que ChatGPT n’est pas un bon médecin
item.description: Les chatbots se piquent maintenant de donner des conseils médicaux à partir des données collectées au fil des ans par les applications de suivi de la santé. Le seul problème, c'est qu'ils racontent n'importe quoi.

item.title: Verizon issues rare refund to Boston users who are locked out of key TV channels to show that 'we have their back'
item.description: Verizon customers in Boston have been given refunds as major TV channels continue to be unavailable.

item.title: La PS5 Slim avec lecteur de disque revient à un super prix pour la fin des soldes d’hiver
item.description: La console de Sony, la PlayStation 5 dans sa version Slim avec lecteur Blu-Ray, revient dans la valse des soldes. On la trouve en ce moment à 475 euros au lieu de 549 euros chez Pixmania.

item.title: « Ridicule » : pourquoi le bracelet Whoop sans écran fait polémique à l’Open d’Australie de tennis
item.description: Lors de l'Open d'Australie de tennis, plusieurs joueurs ont dû retirer leur bracelet Whoop de leur poignet.

item.title: L’héritier du BMW C1 arrive enfin : 12 900 € pour faire de l’interfile sans casque
item.description: La startup allemande XYTE Mobility lance le XYTE ONE, un véhicule électrique à trois roues mêlant l'agilité d'un scooter avec la sécurité d'une voiture électrique. Accessible avec un simple permis B et dispensant du port du casque, il arrivera sur le marché de la micro-mobilité urbaine dès le premier trimestre 2026.

item.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of staff to redirect resources to AI
item.description: Pinterest says it's "reallocating resources to AI-focused roles and teams that drive AI adoption and execution" and "prioritizing AI‑powered products and capabilities."

item.title: Trump is threatening to hike tariffs on these South Korean goods. Here’s why
item.description: Trump announced on social media that import taxes would be raised from 15% to 25%. President Donald Trump said Monday he is increasing tariffs on South Korean goods because the country’s legislature has yet to approve the trade framework announced last year.Trump said on social media that import taxes would be raised on autos, lumber and pharmaceutical drugs from South Korea with the rate on other goods going from 15% to 25%. The U.S. president previously imposed the tariffs by declaring an economic emergency and bypassing Congress, while South Korea needed legislative approval for the framewo...

item.title: L’État français va bloquer Google Meet, Zoom et Microsoft Teams
item.description: La France veut aller au bout de la démarche avec son application Visio. Elle bloquera dans le courant de l'année l'accès aux solutions étrangères comme Google Meet ou Microsoft Teams.
